image.altText: ACT Labor Leader Andrew Barr and Canberra Liberals Leader Elizabeth Lee shake hands

props.synopsis: Just over half of the 213 policies that have been submitted for costing by the three biggest parties have been costed so far.

title.children: Here's what the ACT's major parties plan to spend if they're elected tomorrow

image.altText: Leanne Castley, smiling, in front of a sports ground with The Canberra Hospital in the background.

props.synopsis: On the eve of the election, ACT Labor is found in breach of electoral laws for running advertisements that were "inaccurate and misleading" when criticising the shadow health minister's position on abortion.

title.children: ACT Labor forced to remove 'inaccurate and misleading' election ad

image.altText: Stephen Mitchell sits at a cafe holding a take-away coffee cup.

props.synopsis: Stephen Mitchell is already serving a jail term for sexual offences against six girls during his time as a national rock climbing coach.

title.children: 'He took advantage of me': Convicted paedophile is given more jail time for separate act of indecency

image.altText: An aerial view of Lake Burley Griffin soon after filling up in 1964.

props.synopsis: It's played host to everything from nude swimmers and the Queen of England — not at the same time — to hot air balloons and giant Murray Cod. As Canberra marks 60 years since the inauguration of Lake Burley Griffin, let's take a look at how far it's come.

title.children: It's been 60 years since Lake Burley Griffin was first filled but it wasn't all smooth sailing

image.altText: A mangled grain silo amid a huge pile of spilled wheat on the bank of a river.

props.synopsis: Two silos collapsed at Manildra's plant at Bomaderry, NSW overnight, spewing thousands of tonnes of wheat near the Shoalhaven River. Authorities say a third silo containing 500 tonnes of wheat has been badly damaged and an exclusion zone has been set up.

title.children: 30m-high silo falls into the Shoalhaven River after double collapse, third in jeopardy amid massive wheat spill

image.altText: Lia Finocchiaro, Andrew Barr and Elizabeth Lee.

props.synopsis: Could the surprise devastation witnessed in the Northern Territory election a few months ago foreshadow a similar result in the ACT this weekend, or is the shared "territory" label where the similarities between the NT and the ACT end?

title.children: According to this expert, there is one key thing the Canberra Liberals need to do to unseat Labor

image.altText: a woman giving the finger at a man as he walks away

props.synopsis: Elizabeth Lee made the gesture towards a journalist at a press conference after the ACT Property Council's leaders' debate on Wednesday.

title.children: Canberra Liberals leader Elizabeth Lee makes rude gesture at journalist following tense press conference exchange

image.altText: a photo taken from a plane window shows a thin river with lots of twists and turns, and native vegetation on the bank.

props.synopsis: A long stretch of the Murray River and the massive Macquarie Marshes wetland in NSW could soon be designated "threatened ecological communities" by the federal government. Here's what that means.

title.children: Part of an iconic Australian river could soon be on the 'critically endangered' list

image.altText: A person reads a "how to vote" card at a temporary electronic voting booth at a polling place.

props.synopsis: From news, analysis and explainers through to election previews, key electorates and candidates, ACT Votes has the latest on the upcoming state election. Click through to read more.

title.children: ACT Votes 2024 — read, watch and listen to the latest election news and analysis

image.altText: A man in a safari suit and a woman in a white dress walk on a red rock

props.synopsis: Charles and Diana's tour of Australia helped win back the hearts and minds of the monarch's subjects, but it was also where their relationship was forever altered.

title.children: King Charles and Queen Camilla are visiting Australia. In 1983, his tour with Diana was 'utterly traumatic'

image.altText: Jim Chalmers in the blue room.

props.synopsis: Jim Chalmers gives his strongest indication yet that the government will not bring in changes to negative gearing, as it cases fresh pressure over its housing policies.

title.children: Treasurer says Australians 'shouldn't anticipate' changes to negative gearing as part of housing policy

image.altText: A red sky looms over horizon far away. Dirt road with worksite alongside it.

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology says a possible tornado could have caused the extensive power outage in far west New South Wales as SA's Energy Minister confirms mining operations at Olympic Dam will be down for up to a week following storms in SA's north.

title.children: Broken Hill hit by 'possible tornado', as storms affect mining operations at Olympic Dam

image.altText: Heavy rain floods highways and restaurants in Melbourne

props.synopsis: Severe thunderstorms have caused flash flooding across Victoria, cutting major roads and inundating some properties.

title.children: Major Melbourne roads flooded as storms sweep across the state

image.altText: Carl Ditterich leaving court

props.synopsis: A Melbourne court has heard the alleged incidents related to one teenage girl and took place in the south-east Melbourne suburb of Moorabbin in 1985.

title.children: Former footballer Carl Ditterich to stand trial over historic sexual assault allegations

image.altText: Five young men stand with their backs to a large crowd, smiling to the camera

props.synopsis: Directioners recall their memories of the band with pride. For one demographic, there'll never be another One Direction or Liam Payne.

title.children: Why Liam Payne's death is hitting one demographic particularly hard

image.altText: Orange logo of brand Temu displayed on a phone

props.synopsis: CHOICE purchased and tested 15 toys at random from Temu, with most carrying deadly coin and button battery hazards. Every product failed safety testing against Australian regulations.

title.children: Deadly hazards found in Temu products spark calls for 'rebooted' consumer safety laws

image.altText: Two women crying while hugging a baby boy.

props.synopsis: An infant was allegedly sold by his father to a married couple desperate to have children in one of the latest cases of baby trafficking in Indonesia.

title.children: 'I want my husband to be punished': Indonesian police say a dad sold his 11-month-old baby to fund gambling

image.altText: craig moore in a branded election cap in front of his election sign

props.synopsis: Craig William Moore was jailed for 14 months after he was convicted of rape in 1997.

title.children: LNP 'unaware' an independent it preferenced in Brisbane electorate was a convicted rapist and former porn star

image.altText: Flight Centre sign at shopfront at South Bank in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: A day after setting a new record high, the Australian share market ended lower on Friday after data confirmed China's economy was still losing steam despite the country ramping up its economic stimulus packages.

title.children: ASX 200 retreats from record high as Flight Centre nosedives and China's economy slows — as it happened

image.altText: A woman in a bike helmet with brown hair rides her bike in the country.

props.synopsis: Lisa Millar returns to her home town of Kilkivan to learn about its new rail trail and is reminded the decline of these small country towns doesn't have to be a permanent trend.

title.children: How do you give a dying town a second life? The answer for Lisa Millar's childhood home was a rail trail

image.altText: a man sitting at a computer

props.synopsis: For years, ATO investigators have been trawling the social media accounts of possible tax cheats looking for evidence of hidden lavish lifestyles. Now they're looking to automate the process.

title.children: Australian Taxation Office hopes to scrape social media, dark web with new tool against tax cheats

image.altText: black and white photo of woman with 1960s hair cut and wearing floral dress

props.synopsis: Hollywood golden age actor Mitzi Gaynor starred in musicals with Bing Crosby, Frank Sinatra and Gene Kelly, but is best known for her role as Nellie Forbush in the film South Pacific.

title.children: Star of South Pacific Mitzi Gaynor dies aged 93

image.altText: The GWS Giants leave the field after a loss, looking upset

props.synopsis: Women who work within the AFL community and fans of the game are left feeling hurt and angered by the fallout of the GWS post-season function saga, while many have been targeted online after speaking out against the behaviour.

title.children: Women in the AFL left hurt and disappointed in wake of GWS costume scandal

image.altText: Exterior front signage at the Northern Land Council offices in Darwin.

props.synopsis: The Northern and Anindilyakwa land councils have been raided by Australia's federal corruption watchdog, as the ALC's controversial boss is sacked from his role.

title.children: Powerful NT land councils raided by National Anti-Corruption Commission

image.altText: A full moon is visible low on the horizon above the Sydney Opera House

props.synopsis: If you noticed the moon seemed a little brighter than usual on Thursday night, you weren't imagining it.

title.children: Photographers capture brightest supermoon of the year

image.altText: A man goes in for a brain scan

props.synopsis: Brendan Cowell's new limited ABC series Plum shines a light on rugby league, poetry and the impact of a life hard-lived while also shining a light on the toll concussion can take on a sporting hero.

title.children: Plum is an unflinching look at rugby league, Australian masculinity and the impact of concussion

image.altText: Donald Trump is shielded by secret service as blood spreads from an injury on his ear

props.synopsis: Secret Service personnel displayed a "troubling" lack of critical thinking as to the risk posed to the former president in the lead-up to the July assassination attempt, an independent review finds.

title.children: 'No-one from the Secret Service' told Donald Trump's protection detail about potential assassin, report finds

image.altText: Daniel Andrews wearing glasses and black jacket with the british flag behind him

props.synopsis: The former Victorian premier has been appointed chair of Orygen.

title.children: Daniel Andrews takes up new role in youth mental health

image.altText: A close-up of Lia Finocchiaro as she addresses the media.

props.synopsis: The NT's new Country Liberal Party government has passed legislation to lower the age of criminal responsibility from 12 to 10. It comes just a day after the government pushed through tougher bail laws and extra powers for police.

title.children: NT passes law to lower age of criminal responsibility to 10 years old

image.altText: Southern right whales mating

props.synopsis: A mating frenzy captured on camera off Western Australia's south coast is a promising sign for southern right numbers still recovering from decades of whaling, according to a marine biologist.

title.children: Whale mating 'orgy' off Australian coast a promising sign for southern right species

image.altText: A doctor measures a patient's waist in her office.

props.synopsis: Despite widespread criticism, BMI continues to be the go-to for measuring some health risks. Now the "body roundness index" is gaining traction as a viable alternative. What's stopping it being used?

title.children: Why measuring body 'roundness' could be a better indicator of health than BMI

image.altText: Peter Dutton, wearing a suit and tie, glares from his seat in parliament.

props.synopsis: The Coalition is well-placed for next year's election, but the looming battle over industrial relations could be more dangerous for Peter Dutton than his risky gamble to promote nuclear energy.

title.children: Whatever his policy, Peter Dutton will be a big target on workplace relations

image.altText: A close-up photograph of several black balls washed up on sand with lapping water in the background.

props.synopsis: It's time to test how much attention you've been paying to the news!

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Politicians with property portfolios, a bold starship test and mysterious beach balls
